timeline.message: No duplicate flagging of bidirectional Ways
Replacing Atlas ID in the violation info with OSM ID

timeline.author: Bentleysb

timeline.message: Adding MapRoulette challenge; minor refactoring to accommodate code review comments

timeline.bodyText: nit: Since there is only a single instruction, you can use Collections.singletonList instead of Arrays.asList.
timeline.author: sayas01

timeline.bodyText: Looks like the RailwayTag class already has a public method isRailway which could be leveraged here like: RailwayTag.isRailway()
timeline.author: sayas01

timeline.bodyText:
One other way to check this would be to use Validators class. Predicate can be declared as a constant at the top like:
private static final Predicate<AtlasObject> MAJOR_HIGHWAYS = object -> Validators.isOfType( object, Highway.class, HighwayTag.MOTORWAY, HighwayTag.TRUNK, HighwayTag.PRIMARY, HighwayTag.SECONDARY)
timeline.author: sayas01

timeline.bodyText: nit: Could clean this class up by static importing TestAtlas.*.
